meanings.definition: extemporizers: those who speak or perform without preparation
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, the extemporizers amazed the audience with their spontaneous performances.
meanings.sent2: The extemporizers at the comedy club always keep the audience entertained with their quick wit.
meanings.sent3: The extemporizers at the party had everyone laughing with their impromptu jokes.
meanings.sent4: She was like an extemporizer on stage, effortlessly coming up with stories on the spot.
meanings.sent5: The extemporizers in the debate competition impressed the judges with their ability to think on their feet.

meanings.definition: extemporizers: individuals who improvise or make up as they go along
meanings.sent1: The extemporizers in the play adapted quickly to unexpected changes in the script.
meanings.sent2: As extemporizers, the street performers captivated the crowd with their on-the-spot songs.
meanings.sent3: The extemporizers in the cooking class turned a recipe mishap into a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent4: He was a true extemporizer, effortlessly creating beautiful melodies on his guitar.
meanings.sent5: The extemporizers in the storytelling workshop amazed everyone with their ability to craft tales on the fly.
